tit.e: Kenjo-no-shoji (sliding screens of the thirty-two Chinese sages)
tit.cmt: タイトルなので説明訳括弧を削除しました。次行に補足しました。ハイフン削除し、スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 賢聖障子（けんじょうのしょうじ）は、内裏の紫宸殿母屋の北方北廂とのさかいに立てられていた障子。
sen.e: Kenjo-no-shoji are sliding screens that were placed at the main housing of the Shishin-den Hall (hall for state ceremonies) to be separated from the kitakata kitabisashi (northern eaves) in the Imperial Palace.

Kenjo no shoji (sliding screens of the 32 Chinese sages) are sliding screens that were placed at the main housing of the Shishin-den Hall (hall for state ceremonies) to be separated from the kitakata kitabisashi (northern eaves) in the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除し、スペース補足しました。説明訳括弧を補足しました。数字に訂正しました。
sen.e: Kenjo no shoji (sliding screens of the 32 Chinese sages) are sliding screens that were placed at the main housing of the Shishin-den Hall (hall for state ceremonies) to be separated from the kitakata kitabisashi (northern eaves) in the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 「北の障子」、「絹障子」（『江家次第』）ともいう。
sen.e: Kenjo-no-shoji are also called 'Kita no shoji' (northern sliding screens) or 'kinu-shoji' (silk shoji), according to the "Gokeshidai" (the Ritual Protocol of the Oe House).

sen.cmt: ハイフン削除し、スペース補足しました。
sen.e: Kenjo no shoji are also called 'Kita no shoji' (northern sliding screens) or 'kinu shoji' (silk shoji), according to the "Gokeshidai" (the Ritual Protocol of the Oe House).

sen.j: 障子の上は色紙形であり、下を張りひろげて賢聖の像がえがかれた。
sen.e: The top of the shoji is made of shikishigata (colored, square-shaped paper inscribed with verses, then cut and pasted onto the upper portion of large screens and sliding door panels), and the Kenjo sage are pictured on the bottom portion of the screens.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 北側（裏）は唐草模様がえがかれた。
sen.e: On the back side of the screen facing north, arabesque designs are painted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 中央の上には負文亀、下には狛犬がえがかれている。
sen.e: 負文亀 and komainu (a pair of stone-carved guardian dogs) are painted in the top center and bottom, respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処負文亀読み不明
sen.e: 負文亀 and komainu (a pair of stone-carved guardian dogs) are painted in the top center and bottom, respectively.

sen.j: その東西それぞれに4間、1間ごとに像4人ずつ、つまり32人がえがかれた。
sen.e: On the both sides of the above mentioned paintings, there are four slide screens each, and the pictures of four sages are painted on each screen; in total, 32 sages are painted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: この障子は、弘仁年間に書画された。
sen.e: These shoji began to be painted during the Konin era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These shoji began to be painted during the Konin era.

sen.j: 陽成天皇の時代に完成したとも（『皇年代略』）、また寛平4年に巨勢金岡にえがかせたとも（『古今著聞集』）いう。
sen.e: It is said that paintings were completed in the period of Emperor Yozei (according to the "konendairyaku") or the Emperor had KOSE no Kanaoka to paint them in 892 (according to the "Kokon Chomon ju" (a Collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: Konendairyaku大文字にしました。括弧内括弧を［］に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is said that paintings were completed in the period of Emperor Yozei (according to the "Konendairyaku") or the Emperor had KOSE no Kanaoka to paint them in 892 (according to the "Kokon Chomon ju" [a Collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present]).

sen.j: 江戸時代になって、寛政元年、内裏造営のさいに、江戸幕府は図の冠服考を儒学者 柴野邦彦に命じて考証させた。
sen.e: In 1789 during the Edo period, at the time of building Imperial Palace, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) ordered Kunihiko SHIBANO, a Confusian scholar, to conduct the historical investigation of kanpukuko (apparel in the painting).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「冠服考」は用語集にも載っておらず、調査でもはっきりしたことはわかりませんが、apparel in the painting としているウェブサイトがあったようなのでそちらを採用しました。

sen.j: 従来の中央上部の「蓬莱図」を古式に復し「負文亀」の図にあらためさせた。
sen.e: The bakufu had the 'horaizu' painting in the top center restored to the ancient style, '負文亀.'

sen.cmt: 負文亀読み不明Horaizu大文字にしました。

sen.j: 聖賢32人のうち馬周、房玄齢、杜如晦の3人は土佐家伝来の図にもとづき復古させた。
sen.e: Among the 32 sages, Zhou MA, Xuanling FANG and Ruhui Duhad been restored based on the Tosa family's ancestral paintings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: DU大文字にしました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 羊祐以下倪寛までの8人は『年中行事』の図にもとづき、蘧伯玉、虞世南の2人は孔門弟子の図と十八学士のなかから選考し復古させた。
sen.e: Similarly, 8 sages from Yoyu through Geikanhad been revived based on the "Nenju Gyoji Emaki"(Picture Scrolls of Annual Functions), and Boyu QU and Shinan YU as well based on the paintings of Confucian student and the eighteen graduates of literature museum, Bungakukan.

sen.j: ほかの13人もそれぞれ古書に徴して復古させた。
sen.e: The other 13 sages had also been restored based on the information found in historical documents.

sen.j: 住吉内記広行に像をえがかせ、色紙の文字は賀茂保誠に書かせた。
sen.e: The bakufu had Naiki-Hiroyuki SUMIYOSHI to paint the sages and Yasumasa GAMO to write the letters on the shikishi.

sen.e: In 1854, however, some of the shoji had been destroyed when the Palace went up in flames.
